event.headline: A very special, very popular sing-along
event.description:
Warm up those pipes and join us for our WICKED Sing-Along screening, complete with onscreen lyrics. Whether you can really nail ‚ÄúPopular‚Äù or regularly defy gravity, you and your fellow Ozians can be the star of the show alongside your favorite witches.

Please note that our usual No Talking/No Singing Showtunes policy is relaxed for this screening, but let‚Äôs keep it fun and not get carried away.

show.title: Death Becomes Her
show.headline: Keep young and beautiful ‚Äì or die trying!

event.title: <show-title>Death Becomes Her</show-title>
event.headline: Goldie Hawn & Meryl Streep slay the screen in this 1992 fatal femme cult classic
event.description:
‚ÄúNow, a warning‚Ä¶‚Äù

What would you do to stay young forever? This is an evergreen question in many cinematic and literary explorations, from Oscar Wilde to the copious vampire narratives we consume, from THE SUBSTANCE to Korean skincare TikToks hocking the perfect recipe for ‚Äúglass skin,‚Äù we are a species obsessed with delaying time's inevitable progression. Robert Zemeckis‚Äô 1992 black comedy (co-written by Journeymen screenwriter David Koepp and Martin Donovan) DEATH BECOMES HER is a classic example of this trope played out in gloriously campy fashion. Goldie Hawn and Meryl Streep are Helen Sharp and Madeline Ashton, two frenemies who compete in all things, especially for the attention and affection of dopey plastic surgeon Ernest Menville (played against type by a delightful Bruce Willis). When presented with a method of reversing and halting their aging by the gorgeous and mysterious vamp Lisle Von Rhuman (THE ICON Isabella Rosellini) both women seize the clandestine opportunity, and from there, things get grim and zany. Overflowing with subtextual sapphic angst and seething with a deep investment in the emasculation of cis straight men, this movie is a freaking blast! Groundbreaking Acadamy Award-winning special effects and hilarious performances from its entire cast helped launch DEATH BECOMES HER to cult classic status (especially amongst queer audiences) despite mixed reviews from critics. As Madeline would say, ‚ÄúScrew the critics‚Äù ‚Äì this movie is a STAR! Help us kick off the 2025 season of Queer Film Theory 101 with a dose of the potion with the motion. Stay beautiful, queerdos (but then again, you always are.)

show.title: Cries and Whispers
show.headline: Liv Ullmann shines in Ingmar Bergman's existential drama.

event.title: <show-title>Cries and Whispers</show-title>
event.headline: Robert Eggers personally recommends Ingmar Bergman's existential drama
event.description:
Presented in Swedish with English subtitles

CRIES AND WHISPERS is presented here as part of our Robert Eggers Guest Selects for influencing his new film, NOSFERATU. ‚ÄúCRIES AND WHISPERS by Ingmar Bergman is perhaps my favorite Bergman film. It‚Äôs also, you know, one of the best horror films ever made, even though it certainly doesn‚Äôt try to be one and wouldn‚Äôt be classified as one.‚Äù ‚Äì Robert Eggers.

This existential wail of a drama from Ingmar Bergman concerns two sisters, Karin (Ingrid Thulin) and Maria (Liv Ullmann), keeping vigil for a third, Agnes (Harriet Andersson), who is dying of cancer and can find solace only in the arms of a beatific servant (Kari Sylwan). An intensely felt film that is one of Bergman‚Äôs most striking formal experiments, CRIES AND WHISPERS (which won an Oscar for the extraordinary color photography of Sven Nykvist) is a powerful depiction of human behavior in the face of death, positioned on the borders between reality and nightmare, tranquillity and terror. (Janus Films)

Presented in Swedish with English subtitles

It‚Äôs also, you know, one of the best horror films ever made, even though it certainly doesn‚Äôt try to be one and wouldn‚Äôt be classified as one.‚Äù ‚Äì Robert Eggers.

show.title: Hot Rod
show.headline: Smack destiny in the face

event.title: <show-title>Hot Rod</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Our most stunt-y, daredevil-y movie party ever
event.description:
Who wants to see us throw a big-ass movie party?!

If that sounds like cool beans to you, then join us for HOT ROD, the supremely goofy cult classic about a small-town stuntman from the guys of The Lonely Island.

We think it‚Äôs absurdist perfection, so put on your most patriotic jumpsuit and strap in for a movie party for all you daredevils out there. We‚Äôll have custom bandanas, fake mustaches (all great men have them), and even different spirit animals so you can choose the one that best represents you while you live your dream of feeling like a stuntperson without having to actually do any, you know, stunts.

So if you like to party, join us for a daring, action-packed movie party celebrating one of the most underrated comedies ever made.

show.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
show.headline: Doink de doink!

event.title: <show-title>Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Let us see that donkey roll
event.description:
With a hilarious lead performance from Andy Samberg, tons of killer cameos including Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, Usher, and Adam Levine‚Äôs hologram (so expensive!), and plenty of big laughs & bumpin‚Äô tunez, POPSTAR has established itself as a modern cult classic.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre inviting you to kick it with the boyz of The Lonely Island at the most baller Movie Party of all time (#sohumble). We‚Äôll have onscreen lyrics so you can get in on the jamz, some extremely humble sunglasses, ‚Äúgold‚Äù necklaces to show you‚Äôre a ride-or-die Connor4Real fan, a tattoo honoring the greatest turtle to ever live, and a Party Wolves business card (DO NOT pay for them to come to this event). And be sure to show up early for our Show Pony drawing contest before the film.

So bring your crew, show us your Donkey Roll, and never stop never stopping at our POPSTAR Movie Party. DOINK DE DOINK!

event.title: <show-title>Nosferatu (2024)</show-title> <event-type-title>Beyond the Grave Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate Count Orlok's arrival with a limited-edition merch bundle
event.description: Count Orlok didn‚Äôt just bring fear and over 5,000 real rats on his move to the big city, he also brought some highly exclusive merch ‚Äì one of which is a rat, admittedly. Join us in welcoming our new dark overlord at our Beyond the Grave screening of NOSFERATU and you‚Äôll get our exclusive sarcophagus popcorn bucket stuffed with a plush rat and a surprise keepsake. Sure, there‚Äôs a decent chance of becoming a mindless thrall of the vampyre, but that‚Äôs a small price to pay for such a rare treasure.

show.title: Terrifier 3
show.headline: Art the Clown is the real nightmare before Christmas

event.title: <show-title>Terrifier 3</show-title> <event-type-title>Christmas Event</event-type-title>
event.headline: Have yourself a Terrifier Christmas
event.description:
Celebrate the holidays with a Terrifier twist! Featuring a special intro from director Damien Leone and an exclusive sneak peek at the upcoming Terrifier documentary, ART ATTACK, be sure to have yourself a Terrifier Christmas.

After surviving Art the Clown‚Äôs Halloween massacre, Sienna and her brother are struggling to rebuild their shattered lives. As the holiday season approaches, they embrace the Christmas spirit and leave the horrors of the past behind. But just when they think they‚Äôre safe, Art the Clown returns, determined to turn their holiday cheer into a new nightmare.

show.title: Persona (1966)
show.headline: Ingmar Bergman's most personal and original film

event.title: <show-title>Persona (1966)</show-title>
event.headline: Almod√≥var & Swinton personally recommend Ingmar Bergman's dreamlike visual poem
event.description:
Presented in Swedish with English subtitles

PERSONA is presented here as part of our Pedro Almod√≥var/Tilda Swinton/Julianne Moore Guest Selects for influencing their new film, THE ROOM NEXT DOOR. ‚ÄúThis sense of two women being in such a liaison that they kind of become, if not one, they become a sort of melange of two souls was really what we wanted to look at and PERSONA is the masterpiece in this regard.‚Äù ‚Äì Tilda Swinton.

By the mid-'60s, Ingmar Bergman had already conjured many of the cinema‚Äôs most unforgettable images. But with the radical PERSONA, this supreme artist attained new levels of visual poetry. In the first of a series of legendary performances for Bergman, Liv Ullmann plays a stage actor who has inexplicably gone mute; an equally mesmerizing Bibi Andersson is the garrulous young nurse caring for her in a remote island cottage. While isolated together there, the women perform a mysterious spiritual and emotional transference that would prove to be one of cinema‚Äôs most influential creations. Acted with astonishing nuance and shot in stark contrast and soft light by the great Sven Nykvist, PERSONA is a penetrating, dreamlike work of profound psychological depth. (Janus)

contentBlocks.paragraphs:
Presented in Swedish with English subtitles

show.title: An American Werewolf In London
show.headline: From the director of ANIMAL HOUSE, a different kind of animal

event.title: <show-title>An American Werewolf In London</show-title>
event.headline: Bark at the moon in 35mm.
event.description:
While hiking in England, David (David Naughton) and Jack (Griffin Dunne) are attacked by a werewolf. David makes it out alive‚Äîsort of. With the help of Alex (Jenny Agutter), David tries to make sense of his beastly instincts . . . and his new best friend, who is also a rotting corpse. Written and directed by John Landis (COMING TO AMERICA) and featuring miraculous Academy-Award-winning special effects from Rick Baker (VIDEODROME), this is revisionist 1980s horror that does everything right. This includes using the doo-wop song ‚ÄúBlue Moon‚Äù to soundtrack a werewolf‚Äôs gore-soaked rampage.

Screening an archival 35mm print.

show.title: Disembodied
show.headline: 4K restoration of the body horror acid trip

event.title: <show-title>Disembodied</show-title>
event.headline: 4K restoration of the body horror acid trip
event.description:
Indebted to David Lynch's ERASERHEAD, Ed Wood's PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE, and Frank Henenlotter's BRAIN DAMAGE, DISEMBODIED is a cinematic acid trip that blurs the line between horror and experimental art. The story follows Connie Sproutz, a gothed-out scientist who checks into the decrepit Grand Hotel to continue her experiments...and turn people into slime before eating them. Shot in Reno by director Willam Kersten on gritty 16mm film, this DIY passion project is filled with stop-motion effects, gory body horror, and surrealist visuals. Bleeding Skull is honored to present a 4K restoration of the original, uncut version of DISEMBODIED for the first time ever.

4K restoration courtesy of Bleeding Skull

show.title: Green Room
show.headline: Jeremy Saulnier's Punks vs. Nazis survivalist thriller.

event.title: <show-title>Green Room</show-title>
event.headline: Jeremy Saulnier's Punks vs. Nazis survivalist thriller.
event.description:
Down on their luck punk rockers The Ain‚Äôt Rights (Anton Yelchin, Imogene Poots, Alia Shawkat) are finishing up a long and unsuccessful tour, and are about to call it quits when they get an unexpected booking at an isolated, run-down club deep in the backwoods of Oregon. What seems merely to be a third-rate gig escalates into something much more sinister when they witness an act of violence backstage that they weren‚Äôt meant to see. Now trapped backstage, they must face off against the club‚Äôs depraved owner, Darcy Banker (Patrick Stewart), a man who will do anything to protect the secrets of his nefarious enterprise. But while Darcy and his henchmen think the band will be easy to get rid of, The Ain‚Äôt Rights prove themselves much more cunning and capable than anyone expected, turning the tables on their unsuspecting captors and setting the stage for the ultimate life-or-death showdown. (A24)

DCP courtesy of A24

show.title: Dinner in America
show.headline: A DIY love letter to being yourself and being punk AF

event.title: <show-title>Dinner in America</show-title>
event.headline: A DIY love letter to being yourself and being punk AF
event.description:
In a dreary Midwestern suburb, aggro punk rocker Simon (Kyle Gallner, JENNIFER'S BODY) finds himself on the run again after a bout of arson and a close call with the police. A chance encounter with the spirited and socially awkward Patty (Emily Skeggs, THE MISEDUCATION OF CAMERON POST) provides him a place to lay low. As the two embark on a series of misadventures, they begin to realize they have a lot more in common than they first expected‚Ä¶ (Arrow Films)

DCP courtesy of Monument Releasing

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Drop Dead Fred
show.headline: What if your imaginary friend came back?

event.title: <show-title>Drop Dead Fred</show-title>
event.headline: What if your imaginary friend came back?
event.description:
Much beloved by those who grew up in the early ‚Äô90s, DROP DEAD FRED is about a young woman (Phoebe Cates, GREMLINS) whose mental health takes a nosedive after her husband runs off with a young blonde. Kids love marital problems! Throw in some blue language and sexual situations, and it's a wonder any parent let their child view this odd BEETLEJUICE riff.

Rik Mayall (The Young Ones) is the titular DROP DEAD FRED. With a face as elastic as Jim Carrey and a unique screamy delivery, he bulldozes through every scene, chewing it up and spitting it out. Cates gives an empathetic performance as the victim of an overbearing mother, a philandering husband, and the world's most obnoxious imaginary friend.

Sure, critics may not have loved it, but kids of the ‚Äô90s liked their entertainment weird and wacky, and DROP DEAD FRED‚Äôs gross-out hijinks (paired with valuable life lessons, of course) fit the bill. Maybe that‚Äôs why we‚Äôre still watching it all these years later.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Intr√©pidos Punks
show.headline: A sublime piece of '80s punksploitation, newly restored

event.title: <show-title>Intr√©pidos Punks</show-title>
event.headline: A sublime piece of '80s punksploitation, newly restored
event.description:
Presented in Spanish with English subtitles

MAD MAX through the lens of Mexican genre cinema, INTR√âPIDOS PUNKS is a biker exploitation film with DIY grit and anarchic attitude to burn. Violent gang leader Tarzan has just broken loose from prison, and he and his punk compatriots are ready to wreak havoc in all the ways they know best: impersonating nuns to rob banks, having wild orgies, and murdering anyone looking to keep them from a good time. With its potent grindhouse atmosphere and live musical performances from the gang itself, grungy lo-fi excellence flows freely in the veins of this Mexican exploitation classic.

DCP courtesy of Vinegar Syndrome and the American Genre Film Archive

event.title: <show-title>Basket Case 2</show-title>
event.headline: Another good display of bad taste from Frank Henenlotter.
event.description:
Frank Henenlotter is a national treasure. If you weren‚Äôt convinced of that fact after watching BASKET CASE, FRANKENHOOKER, or BRAIN DAMAGE, the joyful perversion of BASKET CASE 2 will make you a believer. Immediately after the events of BASKET CASE, Duane and his heinously malformed brother Belial are ‚Äúrescued‚Äù by a sweet old lady named Ruth. But the secrets in Ruth‚Äôs attic might be more than the brothers can handle. BASKET CASE 2 defies expectations to stand tall as a beautiful melding of John Waters‚Äô POLYESTER, H.G. Lewis‚Äô THE GRUESOME TWOSOME, and Tod Browning‚Äôs FREAKS. In other words, director Henenlotter delivers everything you could possibly want out of a sequel to a movie about a deformed monster who lives in a wicker basket and eats people‚Äôs faces for breakfast. (AGFA)

DCP courtesy of Troma Films and the American Genre Film Archive.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We‚Äôd love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
